jobDescription: Who we are: Meridian Health Plan is a family-owned, family-operated company of passionate leaders, achievers, and innovators dedicated to making a difference in the lives of our members, our providers and in the healthcare industry.  We provide government-based health plans (Medicare, Medicaid, and the Health Insurance Marketplace) in five different states (Michigan, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, and Ohio).  Our employees work hard, play hard, and give back. Meridian employees enjoy: Happy hours, special events, company sports teams, potlucks, Bagel Fridays, weekly Executive Lunches, and volunteer opportunities. A Day in the Life of a Sr. Data Analyst: Reporting to the Department Director, the Senior IT Data Analyst becomes the organizational expert with all things data related, including sources of data, sources of truth, file and table content, field names and definitions, data standards, data governance, and meta data. This position is responsible for understanding departmental data needs for reporting and analysis, and will be a key player in the “Data as a Service” function within the department. This position also, provides general operational support and guidance to OLTP systems as it pertains to data issues or requirements. The Senior IT Data Analyst provides analytical and reporting support to help the organization make well-informed business decisions consistent with current trends in the healthcare industry. Leads data analysis efforts at many levels: 1) ad-hoc on demand to sleuth immediate issues, 2) preparing data for descriptive reports in support of operations and/or other requests, 3) creating visual analytical presentations.Leads and mentors junior data analysts.Guides end-users with selection and usage of data. Acts as a data subject matter expert to assist departmental consumers on proper data selection and usage.Performs data quality assessments on proposed data feeds or on existing repositories, utilizing
